intro: Pentapanax racemosus, commonly known as the clustered arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which are followed by dark blue berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
